document.title: Nova Scotia Department of Education and Early Childhood Development

1C47F2300C9643FC8F022D9938A6D5F7.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves the interpretation of a graph.

F6DC45105CE8498F80085DEDB8E6F675.description: Explain, using examples, how different graphic representations of the same data set can be used to emphasize a point of view.

3B16D6E7519140F38EE301C02981485A.description: Explain, using examples, how the same graph can be used to justify more than one conclusion.

0894CE07EDD04B2BB5531A8C4413D9B6.description: Interpolate and extrapolate values from a given graph.

CF976C4B259745E08DDFE6A27B875F5B.description: Describe the trends in the graph of a given data set.

44DF21B261B144848E2414701EC8E3F2.description: Create, with and without technology, a graph to represent a given data set.

803100F956BB4D038255E569C2C3E26A.description: Determine the possible graphs that can be used to represent a given data set and explain the advantages and disadvantages of each.

36DF197B381440159B4AF9666F796858.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that involve creating and interpreting graphs, including bar graphs, histograms.

19105FD9250145D9AA68B93E0BDF98AF.description: Solve a problem within and between systems using proportions or tables (e.g., km to m or km/h to ft./sec.).

6F1E2F543FBE422AA475EC81AE58EC53.description: Explain, using an example, how unit analysis and proportional reasoning are related (e.g., to change kmh to km/min., multiply by 1 h/60 min. because hours and minutes are proportional [constant relationship]).

60082A8E373B4443A593D46A9F91C14E.description: Solve a problem, using unit analysis.

099A071DEA764C24A302FD86D8A262E1.description: Explain the process of unit analysis used to solve a problem (e.g., given kmh and time in hours, determine how many kilometres; given revolutions per minute, determine the number of seconds per revolution).

F6E884D973914033B213C4EC666D8073.description: Students will be expected to solve problems by applying proportional reasoning and unit analysis.

9D2F86B8CDA14A758F30F4FE0CE7D850.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves slope or rate of change.

AC86A6C34678478BA19FABA78D2D658E.description: Explain, using examples and illustrations, slope as rate of change.

DA3E66728E8A489D94ADEA27D42EC94A.description: Explain the implications, such as safety and functionality, of different slopes in a given context.

2CA10941F870492CAFE44BB93B6AFAE1.description: Explain, using illustrations, the relationship between slope and angle of elevation (e.g., for a ramp with a slope of 7:100, the angle of elevation is approximately 4Â°).

807AF61A55094464ACC7B87ADADF31FC.description: Verify that the slope of an object, such as a ramp or a roof, is constant.

DB322AA0DE1646C58AD6FB9EE65BA426.description: Explain, using examples and illustrations, slope as rise over run.

F3EE1660B0C743CCADFD7CA04A288123.description: Describe the conditions under which a slope will be either 0 or undefined.

0A60EBE66ECC4FD5AECD545130FFFD10.description: Explain, using diagrams, the difference between two given slopes (e.g., a 3:1 and a 1:3 roof pitch), and describe the implications.

AD7882B8637D4B20B9091A5F53003CEF.description: Describe contexts that involve slope (e.g., ramps, roofs, road grade, flow rates within a tube, skateboard parks, ski hills).

D8D5F89167AA4E02A833BA2EEC909056.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of slope as rise over run, as rate of change, by solving problems.

51280B1A0B3644F88C8A7E9E8DFB1952.description: Identify and correct errors in a solution to a problem that involves a formula.

D92C76BF7DDC4894A4E35FB59A3F8D5E.description: Create and solve a contextual problem that involves a formula.

DA1D59FF2BA141E4A48FD47E6A9EDC98.description: Describe, using examples, how a given formula is used in a trade or an occupation.

7E5E54932FAE4AB995A444D9B4393474.description: Explain and verify why different forms of the same formula are equivalent.

77D7B12E717542A49C11188A3DB16611.description: Solve a contextual problem involving the application of a formula that requires manipulation.

FEE635BD288F4C908657BDA8BEC0FAAD.description: Solve a contextual problem involving the application of a formula that does not require manipulation.

16D5980D36D34A249EFA0F34EEA7E0E2.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that require the manipulation and application of formulas related to volume and capacity, surface area, slope and rate of change, simple interest, finance charges.

C3C9E646AFB84F7A80B57D899D86490C.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves credit linked to sales promotions.

1ABBE301A2B84412AF428C2E9DA5C61A.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves credit cards or loans.

A1D167E2914546BDB861A553A4A02009.description: Compare credit card options from various companies and financial institutions.

7F723850567F4D5581F2F58E29E60D03.description: Describe strategies to use credit effectively, such as negotiating interest rates, planning payment timelines, reducing accumulated debt, and timing purchases.

39E5445A2F464C2AB7200F82365DA1B5.description: Make informed decisions and plans related to the use of credit, such as service charges, interest, payday loans, and sales promotions, and explain the reasoning.

4C88306727A14DC284E83D97686B56D8.description: Compare advantages and disadvantages of different types of credit options, including bank and store credit cards, personal loans, lines of credit, and overdraft.

F5DE3486EB6E4C48AFA55639A7426BD9.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of credit options, including credit cards and loans.

4634C0EF42704F40828A2A3B617EA2CE.description: Describe ways that ensure the security of personal and financial information (e.g., passwords, encryption, protection of personal identification number [PIN] and other personal identity information).

490E145233E0459BB1956D6CF2716381.description: Describe the advantages and disadvantages of debit card purchases.

6610E16B6E2B40E38AF0092A9B489B47.description: Describe the advantages and disadvantages of online banking.

528DE4FAC3134EF0ACA7905BA321E700.description: Identify and explain various automated teller machine (ATM) service charges.

0FD856D1493D45B89EE5AC65A8C6B3DB.description: Identify the type of account that best meets the needs for a given set of criteria.

8226318007304531B2E13690FD8E9D94.description: Describe the types of accounts available at various financial institutions.

B6F2B7448C70426190867D64CE476518.description: Describe the type of banking services available from various financial institutions, such as online services.

49A897DD2FEF4568AD4F9ED56B766020.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of financial institution services used to access and manage finances.

9752484511F04E019C3B1D52933C621A.description: Estimate, using the Rule of 72, the time required for a given investment to double in value.

3DF72FC3907943698B5D7DF118F31815.description: Explain, using examples, the effect of different compounding periods on calculations of compound interest.

A9A79B989BFB40A3846FBC197BD1490F.description: Solve, using a formula, a contextual problem that involves compound interest.

C27BA0C7479046E6B3A80CC37BE10CAF.description: Compare simple and compound interest and explain their relationship.

94BEC8E7524B4B3397BEE8C5C412E9B0.description: Solve a problem that involves simple interest, given three of the four values in the formula I = Prt.

9000826DDEBD4A2AB3DC1B2C01DBEC64.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of compound interest.

931A5D51B1714A48B0EAF84D23C56FCA.description: Investigate and analyze, with or without technology,"what if" questions related to personal budgets.

8D373EC193284662B487F547D69A7F02.description: Modify a budget to achieve a set of personal goals.

C40CF55F12C747FD829AD45E930B39EE.description: Collect income and expense data and create a budget.

636E2C6F73EC4EB588E02021B00921E3.description: Create a personal budget based on given income and expense data.

E865CC6B10434E0B83CB825FC9626810.description: Explain considerations that must be made when developing a budget (e.g., prioritizing, recurring and unexpected expenses).

5B13B5F68D4A4B1589A1E35086CB1627.description: Identify income and expenses that should be included in a personal budget.

5859A1976AF54D5A81E0B76369D459CD.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that involve personal budgets.

5C7A8ECBC8E94EEDA6D0EC0CDFD0C230.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves scale.

F7600EFDDF12478BB48C835D4911BDD6.description: Draw, with and without technology, a scale diagram of a given object.

C18B0BE32D244533B655375256ED12C7.description: Construct a model of a 3-D object, given the scale.

FB3803A191494456A67BAB5E3407193E.description: Determine, using proportional reasoning, the dimensions of an object from a given scale drawing or model.

03838C5B69DF45289F5194C1E175F241.description: Describe contexts in which a scale representation is used.

D79BCF2CC2894DF8B7452E4EB9D5A798.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that involve scale.

E06112569FB34684A7DD032506290B2F.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves two or three right triangles, using the primary trigonometric ratios.

157D9F98A7D449AFABA03DF1E194F2E8.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves angles of elevation or angles of depression.

ABA6AC6F34A74AB28C2218115ABE261E.description: Sketch a representation of a given description of a problem in a 2-D or 3-D context.

BB1A0A79CF4D43AE9596BDDA0CF7E320.description: Determine if a solution to a problem that involves two or three right triangles is reasonable.

66ED479AB9904FE8B45B56287A555BD1.description: Identify all of the right triangles in a given illustration for a context.

8F2F29997EC341DCBB40850D2E84BA8E.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that involve two and three right triangles.

1EC6860DFB234BB8BC65093A04C3B635.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves the volume of a 3-D object and requires the manipulation of formulas.

CC96E46B45E449D5976B5E3E774A0EC4.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves the volume of a 3-D object, including composite 3-D objects, or the capacity of a container.

9F829943774D465EBE0B3B96849270B7.description: Illustrate, using examples, the effect of dimensional changes on volume.

C770422C370A463BB03B29AB08ED1A7A.description: Describe the relationship between the volumes of cones and cylinders with the same base and height; pyramids and prisms with the same base and height.

769BD31A370344E8BA29EA2B7178EC27.description: Determine the capacity of prisms, cones, pyramids, spheres, and cylinders using a variety of measuring tools and methods, such as graduated cylinders, measuring cups, measuring spoons, and displacement.

30528583934C41B9A88E6A1F1AC36E44.description: Determine the volume of prisms, cones, cylinders, pyramids, spheres, and composite 3-D objects using a variety of measuring tools such as rulers, tape measures, calipers, and micrometers.

ADA921F3A4884874B4E4D7C151ABFC1B.description: Write a given capacity expressed as another unit in the same measurement system.

49FCC45F3FB745C79366BB7377365480.description: Write a given volume expressed as another unit in the same measurement system.

75AF700E0FC541E5B222355A904E6F27.description: Solve a problem that involves the capacity of containers.

F9E9933CD91348C08DA55941011F6236.description: Solve problems that involve the volume of 3-D objects and composite 3-D objects in a variety of contexts.

F2DFD708A005463B891D40F1C3E6FD31.description: Identify a situation where a given SI or imperial volume unit would be used.

14B71C4875464DA59D6117D7B4117AD8.description: Estimate the volume or capacity of a 3-D object or container, using a referent.

E4DF7B657B234E2F804BB085C4522468.description: Identify and compare referents for volume and capacity measurements in SI and imperial units.

434B1EC45CBC4210AA279824E35433EC.description: Explain, using examples, the difference between volume and capacity.

D6829BCA22B14288ACF74553D521A793.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that involve SI and imperial units in volume and capacity measurements.

95B248BC480943999010C678A160475F.description: Solve a contextual problem that involves the surface area of 3-D objects, including spheres, and that requires the manipulation of formulas.

7A8A171CFFE446639A65C23A6C192A39.description: Illustrate, using examples, the effect of dimensional changes on surface area.

F2AB7D45F5814A5DAE0016BF19BEE79D.description: Estimate the surface area of a 3-D object.

32D6E7A6B1064994882C6E241782F47C.description: Explain how a referent can be used to estimate surface area.

3819FC58F27D4944BD4511F529D6AB30.description: Explain, using examples, including nets, the relationship between area and surface area.

78CC310442BB468B9F382FA9B80C5D60.description: Explain, using examples, the difference between volume and surface area.

EE30833B54B74180A30A8058614EE727.description: Students will be expected to solve problems that involve SI and imperial units in surface area measurements and verify the solutions.
